marketNews.title: Automotive Sales September 2025: Bottom Level Passed
marketNews.content: Gaikindo recorded that national wholesale car sales in September 2025 reached 62,071 units (down 15% YoY, up 0.5% MoM). This realization makes wholesale car sales for the first nine months of 2025 total 561,820 units (down 11% YoY), equal to 62-75% of Gaikindo's 2025 target range of 750,000-900,000 units (versus 73% realization in the same period of 2024). Based on brand, the overall market showed a decline, with non-ASII wholesale sales falling -14% YoY and -9% MoM. From the competitor side, BYD+Denza wholesale sales only reached 1,315 units in September 2025 (down 37% YoY, down 54% MoM), marking the first month since January 2025 with monthly wholesale below 2,000 units. In a separate report, the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded that domestic motorcycle sales in September 2025 reached 567,173 units (up 7.3% YoY, down 1.9% MoM). This result brings motorcycle sales for the first nine months of 2025 to approximately 4.8 million units (down 0.7% YoY), equal to 72-76% of AISI's 2025 target range of 6.4-6.7 million units (versus 77% realization in the same period of 2024). September 2025 is the first month of the year where motorcycle sales grew more than 5% YoY. Key Takeaway: Looking at car and motorcycle sales data for September 2025, we see that automotive sales have passed their lowest level (bottom). This recovery could accelerate further with relatively better macro-economic prospects from government spending acceleration, declining interest rates, and specific government initiatives such as liquidity injections that are beginning to materialize.

marketNews.title: Regulatory and Economic Updates
marketNews.content: OJK is reviewing changes to the minimum free float rule for publicly listed companies, with discussions planned for Q4 2025. Two proposed schemes are: 1) a minimum free float based on market cap for IPO issuers—20% for market cap below 5 trillion IDR, 15% for market cap between 5 and 50 trillion IDR, and 10% for market cap above 50 trillion IDR; and 2) raising the minimum free float for already listed companies from 7.5% to 10% over three years, with periodic reviews for possible gradual increases. Finance Minister Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa told CNBC Indonesia that he expects Indonesia's economy to accelerate to 6% YoY in the second half of 2026, with a possible slowdown in Q3 2025 followed by a rebound to 5.5% YoY in Q4 2025. Reuters reported that the minister is confident about a 6% YoY growth in 2026 thanks to a liquidity injection of 200 trillion IDR to state-owned banks, of which 56% has been disbursed as loans by 10 October 2025, supporting a projected 10% YoY growth in bank credit by year-end. Danantara CEO Rosan Roeslani announced that the company will launch the first wave of waste-to-energy projects in 10 cities in early November 2025, an increase from the previous plan of 8 projects by the end of October 2025. The total target is 33 projects with an estimated total investment of 91 trillion IDR, and 192 domestic and foreign companies have expressed interest. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources said it is restoring mining business licences (IUP) to a portion of the 190 mines that were suspended in September 2025 after they provided reclamation guarantees and corrected administrative documents.

tickerNews.title: Astra International (ASII) September 2025 wholesales decline 16% YoY but rise 10% MoM
tickerNews.content: Based on brand, Astra International (ASII) recorded a relatively better sales performance compared to the overall competitors. In September 2025, ASII reported a wholesale decline of 16% YoY, but a monthly increase of 10% MoM. The better performance was mainly driven by growth in Toyota+Lexus and Daihatsu wholesales, which grew +13% MoM and +8% MoM respectively. Toyota+Lexus again posted monthly wholesales above 20,000 units, after three months previously staying in the 18,000-19,000 range. Thanks to the positive performance of Toyota+Lexus and Daihatsu, ASII's market share rose to 54% in September 2025, recovering from a lower level of 50-52% in June-August 2025.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) Reactivates 5 Citilink Airbus Aircraft
tickerNews.content: The CEO of Garuda Indonesia, Wamildan Tsani, said that at the beginning of October 2025 the airline reactivated 5 Airbus aircraft operated by Citilink thanks to support from Danantara, after the aircraft had been grounded. He added that the airline aims to gradually restore 15 Citilink aircraft by the end of 2025. Earlier, Bloomberg reported that GIAA had grounded at least 15 aircraft earlier in the year due to difficulties in paying maintenance costs.

tickerNews.title: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) Announces Interim Dividend 2025
tickerNews.content: Cisarua Mountain Dairy (CMRY) plans to distribute an interim dividend for fiscal year 2025 amounting to approximately 793.5 billion rupiah or 100 rupiah per share, indicating a dividend yield of about 2.2% as of Friday (10/10). The cumulative dividend will be recorded in the regular market and negotiated on 17 October 2025, with payment on 30 October 2025.

tickerNews.title: Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) Share Sale of 88 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: Shareholders of Barito Renewables Energy affiliated with the controlling shareholder, Green Era Energy Pte. Ltd., sold approximately 88 million BREN shares at a price of 9,400 rupiah per share on 6 October 2025. The total transaction value reached about 828 billion rupiah and was intended to increase the free float of the shares in the market. After this transaction, Green Era Energy's ownership decreased from about 22.99% to about 22.93%.

tickerNews.title: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) Adds 18 Vessels in 9M25
tickerNews.content: Trans Power Marine (TPMA) reported the addition of 18 vessels during the first nine months of 2025, comprising 8 tugboats, 9 barges, and 1 floating crane. This realization meets only about 31% of the 2025 fleet expansion target of 58 units, which consists of 28 tugboats, 29 barges, and 1 floating crane. TPMA's director, Rudy Sutiono, stated that the company targets a revenue growth of +5% YoY in 2025.

tickerNews.title: Celebes Mining Resources (HOPE) Acquires 390.8 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: PT Celebes Mining Resources purchased approximately 390.8 million shares of Harapan Duta Pertiwi from the controlling shareholder of HOPE, PT Harapan Group Sukses, at an average price of 145 rupiah per share on 9 October 2025. The total transaction value reached about 56.7 billion rupiah. After the transaction, Celebes Mining Resources' ownership in HOPE rose from zero to 18.34%, while the direct ownership of PT Harapan Group Sukses decreased to 36.02%.

tickerNews.title: Geoprima Solusi (GPSO) to Be Acquired by PT PIMSF Pulogadung
tickerNews.content: Geoprima Solusi (GPSO) announced that 45.45% of the company's shares owned by the controlling shareholder, Karnadi Margaka, will be acquired by PT PIMSF Pulogadung – part of the Tjokro Group – which operates in mechanical, civil, and fabrication services. The transaction value has not been disclosed. After the transaction, PT PIMSF Pulogadung, which previously held no shares in GPSO, will become the new controlling shareholder and will carry out a mandatory tender offer.
